intro: Endospermum perakense, commonly known as the Perak endosperm, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed surrounded by a nutritive tissue called the endosperm. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
